input_text:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Data Scientist - Remote, USA
About Bizcoder:Bizcoder is at the cutting edge of technology, leveraging data to drive innovation, efficiency, and growth for businesses across the United States. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for data-driven solutions, we specialize in transforming complex data sets into actionable insights. As we continue to expand our capabilities, we are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. This full-time, remote position is open to candidates throughout the United States, offering flexible working hours between 9-5pm or 10-6pm. Bizcoder offers both contract and regular employment options, focusing on finding the ideal match for our team and the successful candidate.
Your Role:As a Data Scientist at Bizcoder, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company and our clients' business strategies. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, conducting statistical analysis, and building high-quality prediction systems integrated with our products.
Key Responsibilities:Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes.Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis.Conduct advanced data analysis and complex designs algorithm.Work on data mining, data science, and data visualization projects.
Technical Requirements:Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.Experience with advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms.Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable.Great communication skills.Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig (experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase is a plus).Experience with cloud services: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud (is a plus).
Experience:3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst.Proven experience in data mining.Demonstrated ability to build solutions for a diverse range of business problems.
Who You Are:Analytical-minded and detail-oriented, with a passion for analyzing and deriving meaningful insights from data.Independent and capable of working in a fully remote setting while managing your time effectively.Eager to learn and adapt to new technologies and challenges in the fast-evolving data science field.Excellent communicator, able to translate complex findings into clear insights and actionable strategies.
Join Us:At Bizcoder, you'll be part of a team that's passionate about harnessing the power of data to solve real-world problems. Enjoy the flexibility of remote work across the US, with standard working hours that support a healthy work-life balance. Here, we believe your expertise in data science is crucial to our success and innovation.

Experience Level (if available): None

Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Experience with advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms. Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable. Great communication skills. Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc. Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig (experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase is a plus). Experience with cloud services: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud (is a plus).
3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst. Demonstrated ability in building solutions for a diverse range of business problems.
